question: Oakwood High School is holding graduation in their Gymnasium this year which has space for 5900 people. After accounting for 650 seats for graduates and 150 seats for faculty attending, how many tickets would each graduate receive to give to their friends and family if the tickets are split equally?
answer:
Add graduate and faculty seats together. 650 + 150 = <<650+150=800>>800 seats for faculty and graduates
Minus seats for faculty and graduates from total seats allowed. 5900 - 800 = <<5900-800=5100>>5100 remaining seats.
Divide remaining seats by the number of graduates. 5100/650 = <<5100/650=7>>7 tickets
#### 7
